TASK-29: Permission Middleware Hardening

Overview

Enhance security by hardening permission checks, adding audit logging, and implementing defense-in-depth strategies for API endpoints.

Current Security Model

Authentication

  • Proxy-based authentication via OAuth2 Proxy
  • Headers: x-auth-request-email, x-forwarded-email
  • Fallback to DEV_FAKE_EMAIL in development

Authorization

  • Role-based access control (RBAC)
  • Roles: intern, contributor, leader, manager
  • Helper: isAdminRole() checks for leader/manager

Current Middleware

function requireProxyIdentity(req, res, next) {
    const email = getEmailFromProxy(req);
    if (!email) return res.status(401).json({ error: "No proxy identity" });
    req.__email = email;
    next();
}

Security Enhancements

1. Enhanced Authentication Middleware

Add Request Context

function requireProxyIdentity(req, res, next) {
    const email = getEmailFromProxy(req);
    if (!email) {
        auditLog('auth_failed', {
            ip: req.ip,
            path: req.path,
            method: req.method,
            reason: 'no_proxy_identity'
        });
        return res.status(401).json({ error: "No proxy identity" });
    }
    
    // Add request context
    req.__email = email;
    req.__requestId = generateRequestId();
    req.__timestamp = new Date().toISOString();
    
    next();
}

Add User Context Middleware

async function requireUser(req, res, next) {
    try {
        const user = await getOrCreateUserByEmail(req.__email);
        if (!user) {
            auditLog('user_not_found', {
                email: req.__email,
                requestId: req.__requestId
            });
            return res.status(401).json({ error: "User not found" });
        }
        
        req.__user = user;
        next();
    } catch (e) {
        console.error('[AUTH] Error loading user:', e.message);
        res.status(500).json({ error: "Authentication error" });
    }
}

2. Role-Based Middleware

Require Admin Role

function requireAdmin(req, res, next) {
    if (!req.__user) {
        return res.status(401).json({ error: "Authentication required" });
    }
    
    if (!isAdminRole(req.__user.access_role)) {
        auditLog('access_denied', {
            userId: req.__user.id,
            email: req.__user.email,
            role: req.__user.access_role,
            path: req.path,
            method: req.method,
            reason: 'insufficient_permissions'
        });
        return res.status(403).json({ 
            error: "Access denied. Leaders or managers only." 
        });
    }
    
    next();
}

Require Specific Role

function requireRole(...allowedRoles) {
    return (req, res, next) => {
        if (!req.__user) {
            return res.status(401).json({ error: "Authentication required" });
        }
        
        const userRole = String(req.__user.access_role || "").toLowerCase();
        if (!allowedRoles.includes(userRole)) {
            auditLog('access_denied', {
                userId: req.__user.id,
                email: req.__user.email,
                role: userRole,
                requiredRoles: allowedRoles,
                path: req.path,
                method: req.method
            });
            return res.status(403).json({ 
                error: `Access denied. Required role: ${allowedRoles.join(' or ')}` 
            });
        }
        
        next();
    };
}

3. Resource Ownership Middleware

Check Project Ownership

async function requireProjectOwnership(req, res, next) {
    try {
        const projectId = req.params.id || req.body.project_id;
        if (!projectId) {
            return res.status(400).json({ error: "Project ID required" });
        }
        
        const { data: project, error } = await supabase
            .from('projects')
            .select('id, owner_id')
            .eq('id', projectId)
            .single();
        
        if (error || !project) {
            return res.status(404).json({ error: "Project not found" });
        }
        
        // Allow if owner or admin
        const isOwner = project.owner_id === req.__user.id;
        const isAdmin = isAdminRole(req.__user.access_role);
        
        if (!isOwner && !isAdmin) {
            auditLog('access_denied', {
                userId: req.__user.id,
                email: req.__user.email,
                projectId,
                reason: 'not_project_owner'
            });
            return res.status(403).json({ 
                error: "Access denied. Project owner or admin required." 
            });
        }
        
        req.__project = project;
        next();
    } catch (e) {
        console.error('[AUTH] Error checking project ownership:', e.message);
        res.status(500).json({ error: "Authorization error" });
    }
}

Check Resource Ownership (Generic)

function requireResourceOwnership(table, idParam = 'id', ownerField = 'user_id') {
    return async (req, res, next) => {
        try {
            const resourceId = req.params[idParam] || req.body[idParam];
            if (!resourceId) {
                return res.status(400).json({ error: "Resource ID required" });
            }
            
            const { data: resource, error } = await supabase
                .from(table)
                .select(`id, ${ownerField}`)
                .eq('id', resourceId)
                .single();
            
            if (error || !resource) {
                return res.status(404).json({ error: "Resource not found" });
            }
            
            const isOwner = resource[ownerField] === req.__user.id;
            const isAdmin = isAdminRole(req.__user.access_role);
            
            if (!isOwner && !isAdmin) {
                auditLog('access_denied', {
                    userId: req.__user.id,
                    email: req.__user.email,
                    resourceId,
                    table,
                    reason: 'not_resource_owner'
                });
                return res.status(403).json({ 
                    error: "Access denied. Resource owner or admin required." 
                });
            }
            
            req.__resource = resource;
            next();
        } catch (e) {
            console.error(`[AUTH] Error checking ${table} ownership:`, e.message);
            res.status(500).json({ error: "Authorization error" });
        }
    };
}

4. Rate Limiting

Simple In-Memory Rate Limiter

const rateLimitStore = new Map();

function rateLimit(maxRequests = 100, windowMs = 60000) {
    return (req, res, next) => {
        const key = req.__user?.id || req.ip;
        const now = Date.now();
        
        if (!rateLimitStore.has(key)) {
            rateLimitStore.set(key, []);
        }
        
        const requests = rateLimitStore.get(key);
        const windowStart = now - windowMs;
        
        // Remove old requests
        const recentRequests = requests.filter(time => time > windowStart);
        
        if (recentRequests.length >= maxRequests) {
            auditLog('rate_limit_exceeded', {
                userId: req.__user?.id,
                email: req.__user?.email,
                ip: req.ip,
                path: req.path
            });
            return res.status(429).json({ 
                error: "Too many requests. Please try again later.",
                retryAfter: Math.ceil(windowMs / 1000)
            });
        }
        
        recentRequests.push(now);
        rateLimitStore.set(key, recentRequests);
        
        next();
    };
}

// Cleanup old entries periodically
setInterval(() => {
    const now = Date.now();
    for (const [key, requests] of rateLimitStore.entries()) {
        const recent = requests.filter(time => time > now - 60000);
        if (recent.length === 0) {
            rateLimitStore.delete(key);
        } else {
            rateLimitStore.set(key, recent);
        }
    }
}, 60000);

5. Audit Logging

Audit Log Function

async function auditLog(action, details = {}) {
    try {
        const logEntry = {
            action,
            timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
            ...details
        };
        
        // Log to console
        console.log('[AUDIT]', JSON.stringify(logEntry));
        
        // Optionally store in database
        await supabase.from('audit_logs').insert({
            action,
            user_id: details.userId || null,
            user_email: details.email || null,
            ip_address: details.ip || null,
            request_path: details.path || null,
            request_method: details.method || null,
            details: details,
            created_at: new Date().toISOString()
        });
    } catch (e) {
        console.error('[AUDIT] Failed to log:', e.message);
    }
}

Audit Log Table Migration

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS audit_logs (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    action TEXT NOT NULL,
    user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    user_email TEXT,
    ip_address TEXT,
    request_path TEXT,
    request_method TEXT,
    details JSONB DEFAULT '{}',
    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE INDEX idx_audit_logs_action ON audit_logs(action);
CREATE INDEX idx_audit_logs_user ON audit_logs(user_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_audit_logs_timestamp ON audit_logs(created_at DESC);

-- Enable RLS
ALTER TABLE audit_logs ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Only admins can read audit logs
CREATE POLICY audit_logs_read_admin ON audit_logs
    FOR SELECT
    USING (
        EXISTS (
            SELECT 1 FROM users
            WHERE users.id = auth.uid()
            AND users.access_role IN ('leader', 'manager')
        )
    );

6. Input Validation

Validation Middleware

function validateBody(schema) {
    return (req, res, next) => {
        const errors = [];
        
        for (const [field, rules] of Object.entries(schema)) {
            const value = req.body[field];
            
            if (rules.required && (value === undefined || value === null || value === '')) {
                errors.push(`${field} is required`);
                continue;
            }
            
            if (value !== undefined && value !== null) {
                if (rules.type === 'string' && typeof value !== 'string') {
                    errors.push(`${field} must be a string`);
                }
                if (rules.type === 'number' && typeof value !== 'number') {
                    errors.push(`${field} must be a number`);
                }
                if (rules.type === 'boolean' && typeof value !== 'boolean') {
                    errors.push(`${field} must be a boolean`);
                }
                if (rules.type === 'array' && !Array.isArray(value)) {
                    errors.push(`${field} must be an array`);
                }
                if (rules.minLength && value.length < rules.minLength) {
                    errors.push(`${field} must be at least ${rules.minLength} characters`);
                }
                if (rules.maxLength && value.length > rules.maxLength) {
                    errors.push(`${field} must be at most ${rules.maxLength} characters`);
                }
                if (rules.pattern && !rules.pattern.test(value)) {
                    errors.push(`${field} has invalid format`);
                }
            }
        }
        
        if (errors.length > 0) {
            return res.status(400).json({ error: "Validation failed", errors });
        }
        
        next();
    };
}

// Example usage
app.post('/api/projects', 
    requireProxyIdentity,
    requireUser,
    requireAdmin,
    validateBody({
        title: { required: true, type: 'string', minLength: 3, maxLength: 200 },
        description: { required: true, type: 'string', minLength: 10 },
        ambition_id: { required: true, type: 'string', pattern: /^[0-9a-f-]{36}$/ }
    }),
    async (req, res) => {
        // Handler
    }
);

7. CSRF Protection

CSRF Token Middleware

const crypto = require('crypto');
const csrfTokens = new Map();

function generateCsrfToken(req) {
    const token = crypto.randomBytes(32).toString('hex');
    const key = req.__user?.id || req.ip;
    csrfTokens.set(key, token);
    return token;
}

function csrfProtection(req, res, next) {
    if (['GET', 'HEAD', 'OPTIONS'].includes(req.method)) {
        return next();
    }
    
    const token = req.headers['x-csrf-token'] || req.body._csrf;
    const key = req.__user?.id || req.ip;
    const expectedToken = csrfTokens.get(key);
    
    if (!token || token !== expectedToken) {
        auditLog('csrf_validation_failed', {
            userId: req.__user?.id,
            ip: req.ip,
            path: req.path
        });
        return res.status(403).json({ error: "Invalid CSRF token" });
    }
    
    next();
}

// Endpoint to get CSRF token
app.get('/api/csrf-token', requireProxyIdentity, requireUser, (req, res) => {
    const token = generateCsrfToken(req);
    res.json({ csrfToken: token });
});

Notes

  • All sensitive operations should be audited
  • Rate limits should be configurable per environment
  • Consider using Redis for distributed rate limiting
  • CSRF protection is optional for API-only backends
  • Regular security audits recommended
  • Monitor audit logs for suspicious activity
